channel.title: Mos Def force fed to demonstrate Gitmo procedure

item.title: Mos Def force fed to demonstrate Gitmo procedure
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

IF I was in his position? Well let me think… from a psychological standpoint if I was TORTURED. You would eventually go into a protective type of shell so you wouldn’t “care” either way. Yes, you will feel pain, but you will lose all hope so caring if others found out or not wouldn’t matter.

When a teenager/little girl gets kidnapped, is raped for 15 years before one day finally being saved. What was she thinking in the time frame of those 15 years?

1-3 years most likely she was thinking oh god somebody please help me!

5-6 years there has to be someone…anybody…

7-10 years I just wish this would end now

10-15 years when he’s finished I can go back to my corner…

Read full topic
item.source: Mos Def force fed to demonstrate Gitmo procedure

item.title: Mos Def force fed to demonstrate Gitmo procedure
item.dc:creator: @Unleashed_Revolution Unleashed Revolution
item.description:
@Unleashed_Revolution wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:23, topic:524341”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=642884.msg4329019#msg4329019 date=1373398341]
Love: I would also claim that Gitmo is an illegal invasion of Cuba. You set up an agreement with a US puppet to use the place all you want, but won’t respect current authorities’ wishes. You make all Americans sound evil.
[/quote]-looks both ways - but aren’t we ? :|[/quote]
So, what if this were to happen to you? What if you were a Gitmo prisoner? Would you want nobody to know, care, or even fathom what happens to you? Your an idiot and a hypocrite.

This is a REAL situation, how are they suppose to protest other then a hunger strike? Are they suppose to fight armed solders with their bare hands? Or scream at them until they finally shut them up? This is the only way that they can get any true attention.

what type of idiot actually willingly for a movie goes through something like that? Lesson here: don't do stupid stuff just for a movie...
As somebody else has said; you're a spineless fuck. He is bringing this to attention as it's inhumane on so many levels.

Read full topic

item.title: Mos Def force fed to demonstrate Gitmo procedure
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:20, topic:524341”]I just asked if that country is part of that convention for torture stuff? if they are on there and refusing to comply, then yes we should. if they aren’t on that page then no. It isn’t our business then.[/quote]http://lmgtfy.com/?q=united+nations+country+list

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:524341”]what type of idiot actually willingly for a movie goes through something like that? Lesson here: don’t do stupid stuff just for a movie…[/quote]www.guardian.co.uk/world/shortcuts/2013/jul/09/yasiin-bey-force-fed-guantanomo-bay-mos-def

His fame would hopefully draw attention to that fact that this is happening daily to 45 hunger strikers in Guantánamo Bay.
there is no substitute for the court of public opinion
Clive Stafford Smith, the organisation's founder, is often the first to volunteer himself for some sort of extreme treatment but, in his words, "nobody has the faintest clue who I am". Which was why I had agreed to ask Bey.
en.wikipedia.org

Guantanamo Bay detention camp

The Guantanamo Bay detention camp is a United States military prison located within Guantanamo Bay Naval Base, also referred to as Guantánamo or GTMO (/ˈɡɪtmoʊ/), which is on the coast of Guantánamo Bay in Cuba. Since the inmates have been detained indefinitely without trial and several inmates were allegedly severely tortured, the operations of this camp are considered to be a major breach of human rights by Amnesty International. The camp was established by President George W. Bush's administra...

The Guantanamo Bay detention camp is a detainment and interrogation facility of the United States military
detainment and interrogation facility of the United States military
facility of the United States
United States

Read full topic

item.title: Mos Def force fed to demonstrate Gitmo procedure
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:19, topic:524341”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=642884.msg4328981#msg4328981 date=1373393745]
funny you linked me to that wiki page when it says on there

The Convention requires states to take effective measures to prevent torture within their borders.

Leave it to that country to take care of their affairs. If there is an issue in another countries state then the people have to get government to do their job. I don’t know where that place is but I assume it is under some sort of countries rule?
[/quote]And what do you suppose happens when a country doesn’t follow the Convention? Should other countries do nothing and allow things to continue to get worse? I guess human rights aren’t that important.[/quote]I just asked if that country is part of that convention for torture stuff? if they are on there and refusing to comply, then yes we should. if they aren’t on that page then no. It isn’t our business then.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:16, topic:524341”]See that’s the thing, we have no need to know about it.[/quote]Maybe you’re OK with staying blind to what torture procedures are inflicted upon others in your own country, but I’m sure others aren’t.

It shouldn't be anybodies business except the militia's what is exactly going on warzone wise, it isn't our business what jail overseas is doing inhumane items. countries have their own laws for a reason. We follow our countries, not theirs. Let the local authorities tend to their country.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Convention_against_Torture
en.wikipedia.org

International security

International security, also called global security, refers to the amalgamation of measures taken by states and international organizations, such as the United Nations, European Union, and others, to ensure mutual survival and safety. These measures include military action and diplomatic agreements such as treaties and conventions. International and national security are invariably linked. International security is national security or state security in the global arena. With the end of World War...

[/quote]what type of idiot actually willingly for a movie goes through something like that? Lesson here: don’t do stupid stuff just for a movie…[/quote]How else would people know about it? It allows people to show and explain how it actually feels. Christopher Hitchens did the same thing for waterboarding.

item.title: Mos Def force fed to demonstrate Gitmo procedure
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Oh come now. This is the exact reason why countries are already at ar. We can’t mind our own business. Point blank. If we keep our men out of their country, and they keep theirs out of ours then you know what there would be nothing to argue about .

-Guy goes over to another country to vid warzones
-Guy gets blown to smitherens
-Angers the now dead guys country
-other country attacks the country that killed the guy
-war starts

yeah…see the issue?

It shouldn’t be anybodies business except the militia’s what is exactly going on warzone wise, it isn’t our business what jail overseas is doing inhumane items. countries have their own laws for a reason. We follow our countries, not theirs. Let the local authorities tend to their country.

item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:11, topic:524341”]Get Obama involved? LOL

but seriously this quote says it best

“When governments fear people, there is liberty. When the people fear the government, there is tyranny.” – Thomas Jefferson

Get the government on your side and you win[/quote]
Because Guantamo Bay isn’t a government institution, is it…

Loveandpower:

Publicity/movie same thing to me. If you are willingly doing something to yourself… #howstupidcanyoube yeah…

Not everyone is a spineless f[size=10pt]u[/size]ck like you. “All it takes for evil to prosper is for good men to do nothing.”

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=642884.msg4328890#msg4328890 date=1373384673]what type of idiot actually willingly for a movie goes through something like that? Lesson here: don’t do stupid stuff just for a movie…

people are on hunger strike in general? bleh! there are people here who can’t even get food sometimes people should be blessed for whatever food they have.[/quote]

He was showing how bad the procedure is. They’re on hunger strike because there are people there who have been incarcerated for years without trial or lawyers.
[/quote]I understand why they are on strike, but like I said they should be thankful they have food there are better ways to protest.[/quote]
Give me a better way to protest tyranny.

Mail Online – 4 May 13

My Guantanamo hunger strike hell: US prison camp's only British inmate describes...

Shaker Aamer, 44, (pictured with two of his five children) is the only Briton being held at Guantanamo Bay. He has been detained without charge for more than 11 years and on hunger strike since mid-February – one of more than 100 prisoners taking...
